name: k8s.container.cpu_limit
help: Maximum resource limit set for the container. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kubernetes-api/v1.23/#resourcerequirements-v1-core for details

name: k8s.container.cpu_request
help: Resource requested for the container. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kubernetes-api/v1.23/#resourcerequirements-v1-core for details

name: k8s.container.ephemeralstorage_limit
help: Maximum resource limit set for the container. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kubernetes-api/v1.23/#resourcerequirements-v1-core for details

name: k8s.container.ephemeralstorage_request
help: Resource requested for the container. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kubernetes-api/v1.23/#resourcerequirements-v1-core for details

name: k8s.container.memory_limit
help: Maximum resource limit set for the container. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kubernetes-api/v1.23/#resourcerequirements-v1-core for details

name: k8s.container.memory_request
help: Resource requested for the container. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kubernetes-api/v1.23/#resourcerequirements-v1-core for details

name: k8s.container.ready
help: Whether a container has passed its readiness probe (0 for no, 1 for yes)

name: k8s.container.restarts
help: How many times the container has restarted in the recent past. This value is pulled directly from the K8s API and the value can go indefinitely high and be reset to 0 at any time depending on how your kubelet is configured to prune dead containers. It is best to not depend too much on the exact value but rather look at it as either == 0, in which case you can conclude there were no restarts in the recent past, or > 0, in which case you can conclude there were restarts in the recent past, and not try and analyze the value beyond that.

name: k8s.container.status.reason
help: Experimental metric, may experience breaking changes. Describes the number of K8s containers that are currently in a state for a given reason. All possible container state reasons will be reported at each time interval to avoid missing metrics. Only the value corresponding to the current state reason will be non-zero.

name: k8s.container.status.state
help: Experimental metric, may experience breaking changes. Describes the number of K8s containers that are currently in a given state. All possible container states will be reported at each time interval to avoid missing metrics. Only the value corresponding to the current state will be non-zero.

name: k8s.container.storage_limit
help: Maximum resource limit set for the container. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kubernetes-api/v1.23/#resourcerequirements-v1-core for details

name: k8s.container.storage_request
help: Resource requested for the container. See https://kubernetes.io/docs/reference/generated/kubernetes-api/v1.23/#resourcerequirements-v1-core for details

name: k8s.cronjob.active_jobs
help: The number of actively running jobs for a cronjob

name: k8s.daemonset.current_scheduled_nodes
help: Number of nodes that are running at least 1 daemon pod and are supposed to run the daemon pod

name: k8s.daemonset.desired_scheduled_nodes
help: Number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod (including nodes currently running the daemon pod)

name: k8s.daemonset.misscheduled_nodes
help: Number of nodes that are running the daemon pod, but are not supposed to run the daemon pod

name: k8s.daemonset.ready_nodes
help: Number of nodes that should be running the daemon pod and have one or more of the daemon pod running and ready

name: k8s.deployment.available
help: Total number of available pods (ready for at least minReadySeconds) targeted by this deployment

name: k8s.deployment.desired
help: Number of desired pods in this deployment

name: k8s.hpa.current_replicas
help: Current number of pod replicas managed by this autoscaler.

name: k8s.hpa.desired_replicas
help: Desired number of pod replicas managed by this autoscaler.

name: k8s.hpa.max_replicas
help: Maximum number of replicas to which the autoscaler can scale up.

name: k8s.hpa.min_replicas
help: Minimum number of replicas to which the autoscaler can scale up.

name: k8s.job.active_pods
help: The number of actively running pods for a job

name: k8s.job.desired_successful_pods
help: The desired number of successfully finished pods the job should be run with

name: k8s.job.failed_pods
help: The number of pods which reached phase Failed for a job

name: k8s.job.max_parallel_pods
help: The max desired number of pods the job should run at any given time

name: k8s.job.successful_pods
help: The number of pods which reached phase Succeeded for a job

name: k8s.namespace.phase
help: The current phase of namespaces (1 for active and 0 for terminating)

name: k8s.node.condition
help: The condition of a particular Node.

name: k8s.pod.phase
help: Current phase of the pod (1 - Pending, 2 - Running, 3 - Succeeded, 4 - Failed, 5 - Unknown)

name: k8s.pod.status_reason
help: Current status reason of the pod (1 - Evicted, 2 - NodeAffinity, 3 - NodeLost, 4 - Shutdown, 5 - UnexpectedAdmissionError, 6 - Unknown)

name: k8s.replicaset.available
help: Total number of available pods (ready for at least minReadySeconds) targeted by this replicaset

name: k8s.replicaset.desired
help: Number of desired pods in this replicaset

name: k8s.replication_controller.available
help: Total number of available pods (ready for at least minReadySeconds) targeted by this replication_controller

name: k8s.replication_controller.desired
help: Number of desired pods in this replication_controller

name: k8s.resource_quota.hard_limit
help: The upper limit for a particular resource in a specific namespace. Will only be sent if a quota is specified. CPU requests/limits will be sent as millicores

name: k8s.resource_quota.used
help: The usage for a particular resource in a specific namespace. Will only be sent if a quota is specified. CPU requests/limits will be sent as millicores

name: k8s.statefulset.current_pods
help: The number of pods created by the StatefulSet controller from the StatefulSet version

name: k8s.statefulset.desired_pods
help: Number of desired pods in the stateful set (the `spec.replicas` field)

name: k8s.statefulset.ready_pods
help: Number of pods created by the stateful set that have the `Ready` condition

name: k8s.statefulset.updated_pods
help: Number of pods created by the StatefulSet controller from the StatefulSet version

name: openshift.appliedclusterquota.limit
help: The upper limit for a particular resource in a specific namespace.

name: openshift.appliedclusterquota.used
help: The usage for a particular resource in a specific namespace.

name: openshift.clusterquota.limit
help: The configured upper limit for a particular resource.

name: openshift.clusterquota.used
help: The usage for a particular resource with a configured limit.
